member.name: M:Trinity.Storage.ICellDescriptor.GetFieldNames
member.summary: Enumerates the names of the fields of a cell. Note that, calling this method directly on a cell, an accessor, or their generic counterparts, will return the names of all available fields. The available fields of a particular cell include the fields that are not marked optional and the optional fields that have value(s). However, if the cell descriptor is obtained from the Schema class (generated from TSL), it returns the names of all the fields defined in the TSL, statically.
member.returns: A collection of field names.

member.name: M:Trinity.Storage.ICell.AppendToField``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Append to the target field. Note that if the target field is not appendable(string or list), calling this method is equivalent to calling .
member.param: The name of the target field.
The value to be appended. If the value is incompatible with the element type of the field, automatic type casting will be attempted.

member.name: M:Trinity.Storage.ICell.SelectFields``1(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Enumerates the fields tagged with a specified attribute, with all the fields converted to . If one of the field cannot be converted to , an exception is thrown.
member.typeparam: The type that the target fields are converted into.
member.param: The desired attribute. Pass null to select all fields in the cell.
Optionally specifies the value of the attribute. When is null, this parameter is ignored.
member.returns: A list of key-value pairs representing the names and the values of the selected fields.

member.name: M:Trinity.Storage.ICell.EnumerateValues``1(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Enumerates the elements of the fields tagged with the specified attribute, with all the elements converted to . Each field satisfying the attribute conditions will be treated as a System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<T> of the desired type . All the elements are "flattened" and yielded into the result list so one cannot determine which field does an element come from. A single-value field that is compatible with type is also treated as a System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<T> collection. If the source of a value needs to be tracked, consider using .
member.typeparam: The type to which the target elements are converted. If an element cannot be implicitly converted, an automatic conversion will be attempted.
member.param: The desired attribute. Pass null to select all fields in the cell.
Optionally, specifies the value of the attribute. When is null, this parameter is ignored.
member.returns: A collection of elements matching the specified attribute.

member.name: P:Trinity.TrinityConfig.ReadOnly
member.summary: Set readonly flag of the Trinity memory storage. The caller hereby promise that it does not modify the trinity memory storage. Note: 1) This flag should be switched on at the very beginning of your program. 2) Once this flag is enabled, it cannot be disabled in the current process. 3) The current process SHOULD NOT update/modify Trinity memory storage any more. Operations, such as SaveCell(), AddCell(), cannot be called in this mode.

member.name: M:Trinity.Core.Lib.Memory.realloc(System.Void*,System.UInt64)
member.summary: C-style realloc. Reallocate a previously allocated memory buffer. The content of the memory buffer is preserved up to the shorter of the old and new buffer. The expanded portion of the new buffer is indeterminate. If size is zero, the previously allocated buffer is freed, NULL is returned. If buff is NULL, it behaves the same way as malloc.
member.param: Pointer to a previously allocated memory buffer.
Number of bytes of the reallocated memory buffer.
member.returns: A pointer to the reallocated memory buffer.

member.summary: C-style malloc. Allocates specified number of bytes of memory.
member.returns: Pointer to the allocated memory buffer. A NULL pointer is returned if there is insufficient memory available.

member.name: M:Trinity.Core.Lib.Memory.free(System.Void*)
member.summary: C-style free. Deallocate a previously allocated memory buffer. If buff is NULL, the pointer is ignored and free immediately returns.
member.param: Pointer to a previously allocated memory buffer.

member.name: M:Trinity.Core.Lib.Memory._aligned_malloc(System.UInt64,System.UInt64)
member.summary: C-style _aligned_malloc. Allocates memory on a specified alignment boundary.
member.param: Size of the requested memory allocation.
The alignment value, which must be an integer power of 2.
member.returns: A pointer to the memory block that was allocated or NULL if the operation failed. The pointer is a multiple of alignment.

member.name: M:Trinity.Core.Lib.Memory._aligned_malloc(System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: C-style _aligned_malloc. Allocates memory on a specified alignment boundary.
member.param: Size of the requested memory allocation.
The alignment value, which must be an integer power of 2.
member.returns: A pointer to the memory block that was allocated or NULL if the operation failed. The pointer is a multiple of alignment.

member.name: M:Trinity.Core.Lib.Memory._aligned_free(System.Void*)
member.summary: C-style _aligned_free. Frees a block of memory that was allocated with _aligned_malloc or _aligned_offset_malloc.
member.param: A pointer to the memory block that was returned to the _aligned_malloc or _aligned_offset_malloc function.

member.name: M:Trinity.Core.Lib.Memory.AlignedAlloc(System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Aligned memory allocation. Compared with _aligned_malloc, this method zeros out the allocated memory. The size must be 8x bytes.
member.param: Size of the requested memory allocation.
The alignment value, which must be an integer power of 2.
member.returns: A pointer to the memory block that was allocated or NULL if the operation failed. The pointer is a multiple of alignment.

member.returns: A signed integer that indicates the partial order of and . A value less than zero is returned if is ordered before . Zero is returned if equals . A value greater than zero is returned if is ordered after .
